result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Clapper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of supervision.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA treatment, counseling and aftercare. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Do not associate with any known illegal substance users. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: Discharge - regular

Defendant Robert A Clapper in court with attorney John M. Murphy.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for Sharon Riek for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. The State indicates there are no Ch. 950 issues and neither party has any additions or corrections. The State recommends Ct 1 in 14CF38 - 3 yrs WPS equal bifurcation/STAYED and in 14CF767, 60 mos RCJ, serve 4 mos, stay 2 mos. No alc/cs-UA's, FT emp and other approp conditions. Defense is in agreement with the recommendation of the State and asks that deft be able to serve his jail time in Walworth County.

BTC: 14CF38, Ct 1-Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS equal bifurcation - STAYED. 3 yrs probation
         14CF767, Ct 2-6 mos RCJ - serve 4 mos/CFTS, 2 are stayed. Huber is granted for employment and may serve in Walworth County

Defendant Robert A Clapper in court with attorney John Murphy.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski   Motion hearing no longer needed. Initial and prelim done on tracking matter.
ZCI
From Atty Murphy withdrawing Motion to Suppress
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

BTC:  Bond mod to $1500 cash.  All other conditions remain.
